Articles.Content: I hope this is the right place to put this image, O.k. so i have this friend thats kinda a coding genius, he likes making weird things for me to explore, and since i have turned him onto this game, he has come up with this.
Does it fly or operate in any way? Or is it just a part that can be attached to things?

I wish I could capture a video, work computer, I know, I should be working, but during lunch time I kinda goof around.

It flies, very fast. I dont know how, you press space bar, and then H,N,J,K for maneuvering, the thing moves very fast. I wish he would just sign up herre and explain things better. It's fun, this I can tell you. Only hull attachments work on it, as I stated so far I have managed to kill a few Kerbals trying to just fly it. I'm pretty sure it's violating the game physics, but it's like finding. Real UFO, and having to figure it out?.

Corporal Vasquez

USCSM/KSCSM 8thBMTS Sulaco

I wish I could capture a video, work computer, I know, I should be working, but during lunch time I kinda goof around.

It flies, very fast. I dont know how, you press space bar, and then H,N,J,K for maneuvering, the thing moves very fast. I wish he would just sign up herre and explain things better. It's fun, this I can tell you. Only hull attachments work on it, as I stated so far I have managed to kill a few Kerbals trying to just fly it. I'm pretty sure it's violating the game physics, but it's like finding. Real UFO, and having to figure it out?.

Corporal Vasquez

USCSM/KSCSM 8thBMTS Sulaco

Yeah that's cool. So he knows how to program it too. I've long wondered about the age of nothing but completely custom ships in this game. I'm about 80% done loading fully customized mechs into the game as well. But in a sense I think it ruins part of the fun. Sure it looks cool but I enjoy everyone having the exact same puzzle pieces to try and compete with.

It'll be interesting as more people either come out of the woodwork like your friend, knowing how to design parts, or as people learn(like I did) how to use blender and Unity.

Edited August 12, 2014 by clown_baby
